title: CheCha - With ADA Wallets
description: ジンバブエの人々は、商品やサービスを購入する際に、小銭の米ドル現金が不足していますが、CheChaはこの問題を解決するために開発されました。

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like it could be a great African Defi Solution. Obviously the big issues are twofold. 1) delivering on the technical side, 2) Marketing and gaining mainstream adoption within Zimbabwe. One issue that needs to be mentioned here is whilst Zimbabweans in general are now comfortable with USD as a currency, they may not in generally be comfortable with ADA/USD rate risk.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has a great entrepreneurial idea. However they lack the technical skills to develop it and are relying on the funding to hire these skills in. This is not necessarily a problem, but does bring in the inherent risk of cost mispricing or unforeseen technical issues. It would be great if the proposer could team up with a technical partner to at least design and plan the technical side and manage the technical hires. The proposal could also benefit from a marketing rollout plan. How do you intend to get CheCha excepted by merchants and customers? hgow will you compete with established mobile money and swipe card competitors? This is definitely a network effect market.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is reasonably detailed on what is will be trying to deliver, however some firm timelines for the deliverables would be good for auditability. What is missing from the proposal are some goals for what success looks like. How many users over what time frames?
f6_assessments.reply:
a) I am able of writing (and mostly did write) the entire project myself, and while I could complete it myself I am a costly resource, and finding competencies is preferable. Furthermore I am a software architect, and entrepreneur. I am more than capable of assessing the technical requirements of the project, and need a marketing partnership (which I do) not a technical one.
b) I dont know what else I need to scope? Its all in the 'plan' section. In summary adjust UI, integrate wallet, create a simple website and promo video, prepare for the next funding round (if needed) for marketing. And otherwise (time and budget permitted) work on security. This proposal is designed to be a 3 month project in alignment with the next funding round detailed in a dedicated section called Timeline, although I see someone else also missed that point, so not as critical on that point. I dont want to add anything more to that list, else it would not be achievable.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has defined the challenge and hopes to solve hyper  inflation in Zimbabwe and provide businesses with lending platforms
f6_assessments.q1: Yes, the proposer has a budget for marketing. Education and marketing will be a tool that can help in order for people engage buy into the idea . This is especially important because of the distrust of the crypto market in Zimbabwe
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has a set number of target vendors and has a set timeline

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a well written proposal.The proposal clearly highlighted the problem of change and currency fractions and also did a great job of introducing the solution in a very precise and clear manner.
These are the kinds of solutions that this fund is created for, to solve real world problems and this proposal sits well suited for this Challenge.
This is great work by the team.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal has a very clear and well written implementation up to the minute details in some aspects.
The proposal did a great job of understanding the challenges of creating such a solution such as security and provided a clear solution.
The proposal did a great job of clarifying the cost and potential future fund request and also being considerate of other Competing challenges in it's current fund requests.
The proposal clearly show given experience with verifiable links and i strongly agree that it can be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
Every Single step of this proposal can be audited and sufficient information was presented very clearly.
The proposal did a great job of highlighting milestones and even went further to detail future steps in future funds.
I strongly Agree that it can be audited.

f6_assessments.q0: This seems like it would also grow the mission in Africa, but is probably more in line with the campaign they are in. I like this is a project "which was developed for Zimbabwe, by a Zimbabwean."
f6_assessments.q1: I love proposals that have working components! From this we can see Anthony's experience by example. We can look at his GitHub for his code. He seems well able to perform the tasks in this proposal, for he already has a working app. Much like their Wise Rabbit project: this is a working app that needs a crypto space.
f6_assessments.q2: I very much like the WADA associated proposals. They are well done, complete, and provide all the needed info. There seems to be a trend with WADA in that they seem to have working projects that just need some funding to get to another level of development. These are the kind of proposals that when approved: improve the world, and with African initiatives: improve it from a cradle of civilization.

f6_assessments.q0: This team presented a blockchain use case which aims directly to the vision of Cardano: Empowering people. This idea perfectly matches this challenge as it will help to improve the financial system / availability of financial services to many unbanked people (or at least have less access to financial services). The team has laid out the underlaying problem and the solution perfectly is helping to solve it. Application like this will help to spread to positive word about Cardano, there this proposal effectively addresses this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Behind this proposal is an experienced team, that has proven their skills in several projects. 
Anthony has participated in various community events and has shown not only his expertise but also his attitude and willingness to improve the ecosystem around Cardano.
The presented plan is very detailed and covers topics like market research, technical aspects, and clear deliverables. Also there is a strategy about how to enter the market with this idea (many proposals are missing this aspect). The budget is broken down in detail and from my experience and perspective fair priced. The detailed plan and the experienced team convinced me, that there is a high likelihood for a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team provides metrics and has defined how success look like, so we can audit this proposal. To improve auditability of this proposal, I recommend adding a documentation source, where the community is able to track/observe the progress of this proposal.
The team has reflected about potential challenges and how to overcome them. Overall, this proposal is not just an idea, this is a ready-to-go project.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is well addressing the challenge and suggests a solution for a clear and specific problem, both are well detailed in the proposal. It seems that the team already dedicated a lot of work to the project, have a local company registered, and have an initial app version. This gives some good confidence about the knowledge and efforts already dedicated to the solution and believes it could be a good DeFI app for Cardano. 

As have some good experience working with tech startups for example as a mentor at Seedstars.com or advisory board at GivingWay.com I can appreciate a well-defined problem and solution. 

More information about the market size potential would have been helpful to understand scale opportunities.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is good information provided about the leading team and it seems a good team with relevant experience combining business and technology. One key red flag is that the venture was not able to raise money and continue progress. The team leader had to focus on his day job. However, well done for making this point clear and explaining that with the funds provided he will be able to dedicate more time to the project. Some other key team members still need to be recruited when funding is available. 

The plan matches the idea with reasonable milestones and timeframe. The budget is well presented and reasonable with about 65% for development and 35% for marketing (although I am not an expert on local prices in Zimbabwe). You did mention that the budget is in the high end and I believe it is important to have qualified team members for the success of the project.

One recommendation from past experience is to focus either on Google or Apple app and do not do both, at least not at this early stage. It will focus the development efforts and will not change much for the proof of concept. In general, the more focused you are, I believe you will be able to progress more and bring stakeholders on board including investors.
f6_assessments.q2:
Overall good KPIs but having more details about the deliverables and timeframe and connect them to the budget would have been helpful. For example it is not clear to me if the budget requested cover all the 12 months deliverable or it covers only the first 3 months and the rest depends on fund 7 support as mentioned before. Overall, the proposal gives confidence in the transparency of information but this last point was not fully clear.

Good Q&As section. I would suggest splitting into two sections QA and risks & challenges (which some are implied in the Q&A), so it is clearer.

solution: 既存のクローズ・ループ・デジタル・バウチャー・システム、CheChaと呼ばれるモバイル・アプリ、交換メカニズムを備えたADAウォレットに導入する。
experience: ソフトウェアアーキテクト（10年以上）テレコムおよびフィンテック業界の高TPSシステムを専門とする。
